required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of Off Label Pediatric Medications
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetics of Off Label Pediatric Medications

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to measure the level of medicines found in body fluids such as blood, urine, spinal fluid of children.

detailed_description.textblock: There is a lack of safety, pharmacokinetic and efficacy data of therapeutic agents in children and infants. Samples used for measurement will be from scavenged samples. i.e. any extra blood/body fluid samples from a test done as part of the standard of care.

primary_outcome.time_frame: approximately 10-21 days.The time frame for the outcome measure may vary depending on the length of the course of the medication.
primary_outcome.description: actual body exposure to drug after a dose of the drug is administered. this is dependent on on the rate of drug elimination divided by plasma concentration of the drug.

primary_outcome.time_frame: approximately 10-21 days. The time frame for the outcome measure may vary depending on the length of the course of the medication.
primary_outcome.description: Volume of distribution is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of a drug. Vss is the apparent volume of distribution at steady-state.

primary_outcome.measure: Terminal elimination rate constant (Ke) and Half-Life
primary_outcome.time_frame: approximately 10-21 days. The time frame for the outcome measure may vary depending on the length of the course of the medication.
primary_outcome.description: Period of time that it takes for the concentration of the drug in the body to be reduced by on-half.

primary_outcome.time_frame: approximately 10-21 days. The time frame for the outcome measure may vary depending on the length of the course of the medication.
primary_outcome.description: the rate at which the drug is eliminated from the body divided by the plasma concentration.

clinical_study.condition: Off Label Use of Medications in Pediatric Patients

study_pop.textblock: children < 8 years of age currently receiving a therapeutic agent at a dose or for an indication not currently included on the FDA label as part of standard of care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children less than 8 years of age
- Receiving a therapeutic agent at a dose or for an indication not currently included on the FDA label as part of standard of care
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lack of consent

facility.name: University of North Carolina NC Children's Hospital
